import React from 'react'; function ADHD() { return (

Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)

Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) is a neurodevelopmental condition characterized by difficulties with attention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity. It affects both children and adults, impacting academic performance, work productivity, and personal relationships.

Symptoms of ADHD

Inattention : Difficulty sustaining focus, forgetfulness, and disorganization.

Hyperactivity : Restlessness, excessive talking, and fidgeting.

Impulsivity : Interrupting others, acting without thinking, and difficulty waiting turns.

Causes of ADHD

Genetic Factors : ADHD often runs in families.

Brain Structure and Function : Differences in brain regions involved in attention and impulse control.

Environmental Factors: Prenatal exposure to toxins, premature birth, or low birth weight.

Treatment Options

Medication :

Stimulant medications like methylphenidate and amphetamines are commonly prescribed.

Non-stimulant medications like atomoxetine may also be used.

Therapy :

Behavioral Therapy: Helps individuals develop organizational skills and coping strategies.

Parent Training: Educates parents on how to support their children with ADHD.

Lifestyle Changes :

Structured routines, regular exercise, and adequate sleep can improve symptoms.

Mindfulness practices can enhance focus and reduce impulsivity.

); } export default ADHD;
